description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list.text: Please complete this voluntary questionnaire for {ru_name}.

list: If this business is part of an enterprise group, please answer all questions for this business in the UK only.
Do not include results for subsidiaries or parent enterprises.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

contents.description: View more information about this survey, including the privacy notice, here (this link opens in a new tab)

list: Innovation, for the purpose of this survey, is defined as new or improved goods or services as well as business processes used to produce or supply all goods or services that have been introduced, regardless of their origin.
These innovations may be new to you or new to the market.

list.text: Investments for future innovation and changes that {ru_name} has introduced at a strategic level (in organisation and practices) are also covered.

list: The UK Innovation Survey (UKIS) is used as the main data source for business innovation in the UK, helping the government develop, improve, and evaluate innovation policy.
Survey information may also be provided to other government departments, approved organisations and approved researchers for statistical purposes only.
View the latest publication produced from this survey (this link opens in a new tab)

blocks.page_title: Business process innovation section

contents.description: This section asks about business process innovation. This refers to a new or improved business process for one or more business functions, that differs significantly from the firmâ€™s previous business processes, and which has been brought into use by the firm.

title.text: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, did {ru_name} introduce any of the following types of new or improved processes that differ significantly from the previous processes?

list: producing or developing goods or services
organisation, business structures or practices aimed at raising internal efficiency or the effectiveness of approaching markets and customers
changes that are still in progress

options.label: Methods for producing or developing goods or providing services
options.value: Methods for producing or developing goods or providing services

options.label: New business practices for organising procedures or external relations
options.value: New business practices for organising procedures or external relations
options.description: For example first use of supply chain management, business re-engineering, knowledge management, lean production or quality management

options.label: New methods of organising work responsibilities, decision making or human resource management
options.value: New methods of organising work responsibilities, decision making or human resource management
options.description: For example first use of a new system of employee responsibilities, team work, decentralisation, integration or de-integration of departments or education or training systems

options.label: Marketing methods for promotion, packaging, pricing, product placement or after sales services
options.value: Marketing methods for promotion, packaging, pricing, product placement or after sales services
options.description: For example a marketing concept or strategy that differs significantly from your enterpriseâ€™s existing marketing methods which has not been used before

options.label: Logistics, delivery or distribution methods
options.description: For example transportation, service delivery, warehousing or order processing

options.label: Methods for information processing or communication, the maintenance and provision of information and communication systems
options.value: Methods for information processing or communication, the maintenance and provision of information and communication systems
options.description: For example hardware, software, data processing, database, maintenance, repair, web-hosting and other computer related information activities

options.label: Methods for accounting or administrative operations
options.value: Methods for accounting or administrative operations
options.description: For example accounting, bookkeeping, auditing, payments, financial or insurance activities and procurement

blocks.page_title: New or improved processes

any-in: Methods for producing or developing goods or providing services
New methods of organising work responsibilities, decision making or human resource management
New business practices for organising procedures or external relations
Marketing methods for promotion, packaging, pricing, product placement or after sales services
Methods for information processing or communication, the maintenance and provision of information and communication systems
Logistics, delivery or distribution methods
Methods for accounting or administrative operations

question.title: Who developed these process innovations?

options.label: Your business together with other businesses or organisations
options.value: Your business together with other businesses or organisations

options.label: Your business by adapting or modifying processes originally developed by other businesses or organisations
options.value: Your business by adapting or modifying processes originally developed by other businesses or organisations

blocks.page_title: Innovation process developers
Innovation investment section

contents.description: This section asks for information on innovation activities during the 3 year period 2022 to 2024 and investments in innovations in the calendar year 2024.

title.text: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, did {ru_name} invest in internal Research and Development (R&D) for the purposes of current or future innovation?

definitions.title: What we mean by â€™internal Research and Developmentâ€™

contents.description: This refers to creative and systematic work undertaken in order to increase the stock of knowledge, including knowledge of humankind, culture and society. It may be used to devise new applications of available knowledge.
R&D activity must have elements of all of these five criteria:

blocks.page_title: Investment in internal Research and Development

question.title: How much did your business spend on internal Research and Development (R&D) in the calendar year 2024?

answers.label: Total expenditure on internal Research and Development (R&D)
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter â€™56â€™ for £56,000

blocks.page_title: Expenditure on internal Research and Development

title.text: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, did {ru_name} invest in the acquisition of Research and Development for the purposes of current or future innovation?

contents.description: Include creative work undertaken by companies, including other businesses within your group, or by public or private research organisations and purchased by your business.

blocks.page_title: Investment in the acquisition of Research and Development

question.title: How much did your business spend on acquisition of Research and Development in the calendar year 2024?

answers.label: Total expenditure on acquisition of Research and Development
answers.description: Enter the full value (e.g. 56,234.33) or a value to the nearest £thousand (e.g. 56,000) Do not enter â€™56â€™ for £56,000

blocks.page_title: Expenditure on acquisition of Research and Development

title.text: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, did {ru_name} invest in the acquisition of machinery and equipment, computer hardware or software for the purposes of current or future innovation?

definitions.title: What we mean by â€™machinery and equipment, computer hardware or softwareâ€™

contents.description: This refers to an asset with moving parts that is used by a business for the purpose of carrying on the business. It covers major (capitalised) machinery and equipment acquired for use in the performance of innovation by the business
This refers to the physical parts of a computer, for example:
This refers to the data or instructions that tells a computer how to work, for example:

list: supporting materials for systems and applications

options.description: Major (i.e. capitalised) machinery and equipment acquired for use in the performance of innovation by the business

options.label: Computer hardware
options.description: For example computer monitors and terminals, printers, keyboards and computer projectors, servers

options.label: Computer software
options.description: For example program descriptions, extensions, supporting materials for systems and applications

Product (goods and services) innovation section

contents.description: This section asks for information about innovation relating to goods or services.
You will first be asked to provide information about any new or improved goods introduced by your business; and second to provide information relating to any new or improved services.
A product innovation is a new or improved good or service that differs significantly from the firmâ€™s previous goods or services and has been introduced on the market.

list: changes to the design of a good
the simple re-sale of new goods and changes of a solely aesthetic nature

title.text: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, did {ru_name} introduce new or improved goods?

list: all new or improved goods (for example, improvement in quality or distinct user benefits)
goods innovations that are new to the business, even if they are not new to the market
all product innovations, regardless of their origin
the simple resale of goods purchased from other businesses and changes of a solely aesthetic nature

blocks.page_title: Introduction of new or improved goods

title.text: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, did {ru_name} introduce new or improved services?

list: all new or improved services (for example, improvement in quality or distinct user benefits)
all services innovations, regardless of their origin

Innovation protection section

contents.description: This section asks for information about protection of your innovations, for example, trademarks or patents.

question.title: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, what proportions of your innovations were protected by patents?

definitions.title: What we mean by â€™patentsâ€™

contents.description: This refers to a type of applied for intellectual property that protects inventions and products, for example machines and machine parts, tools, medicines, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

blocks.page_title: Proportions of innovations protected by patents

question.title: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, what proportions of your innovations were protected by design registration?

definitions.title: What we mean by â€™design registrationâ€™

contents.description: This refers to a type of applied for intellectual property that protects the appearance of a product including, shape, packaging, patterns, colours, decoration, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

blocks.page_title: Proportions of innovations protected by patents design registration

question.title: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, what proportions of your innovations were protected by copyright?

definitions.title: What we mean by â€™copyrightâ€™

contents.description: This refers to a type of automatic intellectual property that protects writing and literary works, art, photography, films, TV, music, web content, sound recordings, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

blocks.page_title: Proportions of innovations protected by copyright

question.title: During the 3 year period 2022 to 2024, what proportions of your innovations were protected by trademarks?

definitions.title: What we mean by â€™trademarksâ€™

contents.description: This refers to a type of applied for intellectual property that protects product names, logos, jingles, giving the patent owner exclusive rights for use.

question.title: Which of the following management technologies did your business use, in the calendar year 2024?

options.label: Accountancy software
options.description: This refers to software that manages and records the day-to-day financial transactions of an organisation

options.label: Booking software
options.description: This refers to software used to provide customers with the opportunity to book an activity, appointment or event

options.label: Customer relationship management
options.description: This refers to technology used to manage interactions with customers and potential customers

options.label: Electronic invoicing (e-invoicing)
options.description: This refers to systems that enable the creation and sending of digital invoices in a structured format that enables automated invoice processing

options.label: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) software
options.description: This refers to software used to manage day-to-day business activities such as accounting, procurement, project management, risk management and compliance, and supply chain operations

options.label: HR management software
options.description: This refers to software used to carry out HR functions, such as storing employee data, recruitment, attendance, performance management, and training records

options.label: Payroll software
options.description: This refers to software used to manage, maintain, and automate payments to employees

options.label: Project management software
options.description: This refers to software used to manage the lifecycle of projects from start to finish, often involves managing project inputs, for example, people working on the project, milestones and/or deliverables

options.label: Supply chain management tools
options.description: This refers to tools used to help oversee, control, and improve the flow of goods and services through the supply chain

options.label: Videoconferencing software
options.description: This refers to technology that allows users in different locations to hold face-to-face meetings. Common software includes MS Teams, Zoom, Skype, and Google Meet

blocks.page_title: Management technologies used in 2024

question.title: Which of the following production-enhancing technologies did your business use, in the calendar year 2024?

options.label: Advanced digital connectivity technologies
options.description: This refers to technologies such as 5G, high speed broadband, satellite connectivity, and other advanced digital communications technologies, such as private 5G networks, Internet of Things and advanced sensing capabilities

options.label: Artificial intelligence (AI)
options.description: This refers to machines that perform tasks normally performed by human intelligence, especially when the machines learn from data how to do those tasks

options.label: Business intelligence or business analytics
options.description: This refers to transforming data into actionable insights that inform an organisationâ€™s strategic and tactical business decisions. Includes the analysis and visualisation of data

options.label: Cloud based computing
options.description: This refers to the delivery of different services through the Internet. These resources include tools and applications like data storage, servers, databases, networking, and software

options.label: Computer aided design (CAD) software
options.description: This refers to software used to produce two-dimensional (2D) drawings or three-dimensional (3D) models

options.label: Cybersecurity tools
options.description: This refers to tools used to protect systems and networks from unauthorised access

options.label: Digital twin technologies
options.description: This refers to the use of virtual replicas of a physical object, person, or process that can be used to simulate its behaviour to better understand how it works in real life

options.label: Quantum technologies
options.description: This refers to technologies that exploit the principles of quantum mechanics, including quantum entanglement, quantum superposition and uncertainty principle. Common quantum technologies include quantum computing, communication and sensing

options.label: Robotics or automation
options.description: This refers to systems or machines that perform pre-defined tasks with little or no human intervention

options.label: Virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR)
options.description: VR refers to a simulated 3D environment that enables users to explore and interact with a virtual surrounding in a way that approximates reality. AR is similar but instead virtual elements are superimposed onto the usersâ€™ view of the real world

blocks.page_title: Production-enhancing technologies used in 2024
Environmental innovations section

contents.description: This section asks about innovations with environmental benefits.

An innovation with environmental benefits is a new or improved product or process of an enterprise that generates lower environmental impacts, compared to the businessâ€™s previous products or processes, and that has been made available to potential users or brought into use. The environmental benefit can be the primary objective of the innovation or a by-product of other objectives.

The environmental benefits of an innovation can occur during the production of a good or service, or during its consumption or use by the end user of a product. The end user can be an individual, another business, the government, and so on.
